title: Variables
text: Represent their speed using variables. The speed of the commercial jet is $$210$$ miles per hour faster than the speed of the private airplane, so you can represent the commercial jet(c) as $$210+p$$, and you can represent the private jet simply as $$p$$.
speech: Represent their speed using variables. The speed of the commercial jet is , 210  miles per hour faster than the speed of the private airplane, so you can represent the commercial jet(c) as  210, plus p , and you can represent the private jet simply as  p .

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the representations of the planes(in variable form) by how long they take.
speech: Multiply the representations of the planes(in variable form) by how long they take.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their time values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{1.6}\left(p+210\right)=2.6p$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug $$p$$ into the original relationship between the walkers to find c.
